articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Units in Huichon
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Units in Huichon
Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave on-site guidance to the work in different units of Huichon City.
					He first went to the Youth Electric Complex.
					
					Looking round various electric goods at production processes, he acquainted himself in detail with production of the complex and highly praised its workers' merits.
					
					Noting that the complex has persistently striven to implement the Party's policy of technical innovation, thus making radical progress in raising quality of products, he said that its experience goes to prove the truth that the biggest reserves for production growth are provided through technical advance.
					
					Then he visited the library newly-built at the complex before advancing the tasks facing the complex.
					
					After his guidance to the complex, he watched a performance given by its traveling art squad. He gave a high appreciation of the fact that the workers of the complex have creditably discharged their role as forerunners in implementing the Party's economic line and creating a new culture, and had a photo session with its labor innovators.
					
					The next leg of his guidance was the Huichon Silk Mill.
					
					He made rounds of various production processes to learn in detail about the conditions of technical equipment and production at the mill and highly estimated its workers' achievements.
					
					He urged the mill to intensify the modernization of production processes and steadily increase production capacity and thus put itself on world level.
					
					He stressed that the mill should provide silk fabrics works with larger quantity of quality silk to meet the lifelong desire of President Kim Il Sung, who took much pain to ensure that all the people wear silks and live on rice and meat soup in tile-roofed houses, as early as possible.
					
					He also visited Huichon University of Technology.
					
					After being briefed on the university before a map on its panoramic view, he looked round a room dedicated to the history of the university. He said that the undying revolutionary feats performed by Kim Il Sung for the development of Juche-based education would remain long with the history of the university.
					
					He acquainted himself with the details of intellectual education and scientific research at the university and highly estimated the achievements made by its teaching staff in training of scientific and technical personnel and scientific research.
					
					Saying that a large number of graduates of this university are now playing the pivotal role in solving many scientific and technological problems arising in various fields of the national economy and blazing the path to new scientific and technological sphere because the university has steadily improved the qualitative level of education true to the Party's policy of education, he highly appreciated again the merits performed by the teaching staff and students of the university on behalf of the Party, the revolution, the country and the people.
					
					He said that the university should turn out more technical personnel able to greatly help further consolidate the foundation of the independent national economy and display its potentials to the full.
					
					He urged the university to briskly open up new fields of science and technology and thus make positive contribution to radically developing the nation's science and technology as a whole.
					
					The striking changes taking place in Jagang Province are a vivid manifestation of our people's steadfast will to build a great prosperous and powerful nation with our efforts and resources in this land at any cost, he stressed.
					
					He was accompanied by Chief Secretary of the Jagang Provincial Committee of the WPK Pak To Chun and Secretary Kim Ki Nam, Department Directors Pak Nam Gi and Jang Song Thaek and First Vice Department Directors Ju Kyu Chang, Ri Je Gang and Ri Jae Il of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Congratulates Gabonese PM
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Congratulates Gabonese PM
Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Kim Yong Il Friday sent a congratulatory message to Paul Biyoghe Mba on his appointment as prime minister of Gabon.
					 Kim in the message wished the prime minister great success in his work for the consolidation of the national unity and the country's development and prosperity.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Congratulates Gabonese FM
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Congratulates Gabonese FM
Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Minister of Foreign Affairs Pak Ui Chun Friday sent a congratulatory message to Paul Toungui on his stay in office as minister of Foreign Affairs, International Cooperation and Francophone of Gabon.
					Expressing belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, Pak in the message wished the minister greater success in his work.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Mongolia Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Mongolia Appointed
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Ri Chol Gwang was appointed as DPRK ambassador to Mongolia, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Birthday Spread to Centenarian
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Birthday Spread to Centenarian
Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- A birthday spread presented by General Secretary Kim Jong Il was conveyed to Pak Sun Im, a centenarian residing in Chongam District, Chongjin City.
					Pak underwent sufferings as a member of the ruined nation before the liberation of the country. It was not until President Kim Il Sung liberated the country that she could lead a worthy life.
					
					She worked hard to repay the great benevolence of the party and the leader. She never stopped working even after becoming a pensioner.
					
					She still keeps herself healthy without having unbalanced diet.

articles.title: Artistes' Sports Contest Held
articles.content:
Artistes' Sports Contest Held
Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The 40th sports contest among artistes was held at Kim Il Sung Stadium on Friday.
					The participants were divided into the groups representing theatrical art, cinematic art and art education. Various league matches were held in football, basketball, volleyball, Korean wrestling, collective forced march and tug of war and other events.
					
					The group of theatrical artistes placed first in the contest.

articles.title: Vol. 83 of "Among the People" Published
articles.content:
Vol. 83 of "Among the People" Published
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Vol. 83 of "Among the People", a collection of reminiscences, was released by the Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House.
					Contained in the book are 19 reminiscences telling about the noble intention of President Kim Il Sung believing in the people as in Heaven, and his devoted leadership based on patriotism and lofty popular personality.
					
					Among them are reminiscences dealing with the facts that the President visited the workers in Kangson at every turning point of the revolution and construction and led them to play as the masters of the country and pioneers of the Chollima Movement and uphold the party with increased steel production and that he guided in detail the work to hand down the valuable gifts displayed at the International Friendship Exhibition to posterity forever as treasures belonging to the people.
					
					 Some of them tell about the facts that the President taught peasants how to do farming one by one and helped younger generations with his warm care to cultivate and display their talents.
					
					 "Whenever recalling the history of the President's field guidance to land of Kangwon", "The tale of the Pyongyang Gold Lane" and "The monument to martyr Zhang Weihua erected in Fusong" are titles of some reminiscences.

articles.title: Paleolithic Relics and Remains Discovered
articles.content:
Paleolithic Relics and Remains Discovered
Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- More than 14,000 pieces of historical relics and remains belonging to the Paleolithic Age have been recently unearthed in the Chongphadae Cavern, Hwangju County, North Hwanghae Province by archaeologists of Kim Il Sung University.
					The cavern is situated 34km southwest of the Komunmoru Site in Sangwon County, Pyongyang City which is known widely as a site of the Old Stone Age.
					
					The cavern is limestone natural one. The width of its entrance is 6 meters, its length from the entrance to the end is 32 meters and its height is 13.7 meters.
					
					The archaeologists found that two layers of culture had existed there in the period from the middle term to the latter one of the Old Stone Age while excavating the sedimentary stratum of the cavern.
					
					More than 30 pieces of stone tools including cutter, hand-taking axe, thrusting tool, scraper belonging to the middle term of the Old Stone Age were discovered in the first layer of culture and more than 2,000 pieces of stone tools such as pusher, carving tool and stone blade belonging to the latter term in the second layer of culture. 
					
					What attracts attention among the relics and remains is seven pieces of human fossils tantamount to five bodies excavated in the second layer of culture.
					
					Two upper jaw-bones and three lower jaw-bones were confirmed as those of Modern men who had lived nearly 20000-60000 years ago. All the fossils are clear in their forms.
					
					The oldest one out of the human fossils is 40000-60000 years old.
					
					The archeological circle of the DPRK termed the fossil "Hwangju man".
					
					Fossils of Modern men in the early age like "Hwangju man" have not been discovered in the region of the East Asia.
					
					The bonfire sites found in several places prove that the Korean ancestors had used fire in their life from time immemorial.
					
					Besides, more than 10,000 pieces of animal bone fossils were unearthed in the cavern. Among them are big bicorn rhinoceros, big-horned deer and others. They, which had lived in the past geological age, do not exist in Korea at present.
					
					More than 1,570 pieces of spore and pollen fossils were also discovered there.
					
					The relics and remains including the human fossils discovered in the cavern give a scientific and theoretical exposition to the fact that people had lived in the Taedong River basin centered on Pyongyang, creating their own culture from the dawn of the human history.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korea Accused of Holding Anti-DPRK War Huddle
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korea Accused of Holding Anti-DPRK War Huddle
Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The "annual security consultative meeting" held by the south Korean and U.S. military authorities comes under fire by signed commentaries of leading papers Saturday.
					They observe that the authorities held this meeting crying out for beefing up the U.S. forces and "providing extended deterrent" as part of their scenario for invading the DPRK at a time when there is a sign of detente on the Korean Peninsula and an atmosphere favorable for the improvement of the inter-Korean relations has been created.
					
					This is nothing but a disturbing move to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK as it is designed to torpedo the process to improve the inter-Korean relations, they add.
					
					Rodong Sinmun says: The "posture of military counteraction" uttered by them over what they called somebody's "nuclear threat" is nothing but a revelation of their criminal attempt to vitiate the atmosphere of dialogue and cooperation at any cost and seek a solution to issues through confrontation and pressure.
					
					The measures taken by the DPRK to bolster up its nuclear deterrent are an exercise of its legitimate right to protect the country and socialism and the security of the whole nation from the U.S. ceaseless nuclear threat.
					
					What is threatening the Korean Peninsula is not somebody's "nuclear issue" but the invariable hostile policy pursued by the bellicose forces at home and abroad towards the DPRK and their reckless military provocations which cast chill over the atmosphere of dialogue and cooperation.
					
					The south Koran authorities should pay heed to the public voices at home and abroad demanding the improved inter-Korean relations and a switchover in their policy of confrontation and stop at once the military provocations perpetrated by them against fellow countrymen in collusion with outside forces. 
					
					Minju Joson warns that the south Korean authorities' act of toeing the U.S. line aimed at doing harm to compatriots with nuclear weapons would only invite a war. They should bear this in mind, cogitate and stop dancing to the U.S. tune, urges the paper.

articles.title: Worldwide Disarmament Called for
articles.content:
Worldwide Disarmament Called for
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- In order to realize disarmament in line with humankind's desire for peace, all the countries should discard the black-hearted intention to realize their hegemonic ambition by securing military superiority to other countries either in nuclear weapons or conventional weapons. 
					 Minju Joson Saturday says this in a signed article carried on the occasion of the disarmament week starting worldwide from today.
					
					 A serious discussion on the issues of nuclear non-proliferation and nuclear disarmament is now under way on the international arena, the article notes, and goes on: 
					
					 The efforts for worldwide nuclear disarmament should not be allowed to play into the hands of the imperialists keen to violate the sovereignty of other countries and achieve their hegemonic aims.
					
					 The disarmament desired by the international community is aimed at removing the military threat of the imperialist powers to the weak and small states, defending their sovereignty and dignity and ensuring world peace and security.
					
					 The disarmament issue cannot be truly settled in line with humankind's desire for peace as long as the imperialist powers seek their sinister aims by abusing the aspiration and efforts for world disarmament.
					
					 The process for true disarmament can be substantially realized only when it is carried out in the direction of respecting the sovereignty of all the countries in the world and establishing equal international relations.
					
					 The DPRK will as ever make positive efforts for accelerating the worldwide process for disarmament and realizing the denuclearization of the world.

articles.title: UN Urged to Remain True to Its Mission
articles.content:
UN Urged to Remain True to Its Mission 
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The United Nations should more satisfactorily perform its mission and role, urges Rodong Sinmun Saturday in a signed article dedicated to the Day of the United Nations.
					 Noting that the UN has an important task to fulfil for establishing a new fair international order as required by the development of the era in the new century, the article goes on:
					
					 The UN should ensure justice, impartiality and equality in its organizational system and activities, not allow any act of trampling upon the UN Charter and raise its authority and properly exercise it.
					
					 The reality requires the UN to play a bold and leading and vanguard role in establishing a new international order. 
					
					 It is the desire of the international community to see the UN Security Council revamped more democratically. It is also necessary for the UN to resettle those issues wrongly handled in the past quite contrary to the purpose and principle of the UN Charter. 
					
					 This is very important for deepening the trust of the international community in it. 
					
					 Only when the UN remains true to its Charter and properly performs its mission and role as required by the times and expected by humankind can a lot of international issues be solved, great progress be made in the development of the times and the appearance of the world undergo a remarkable change. 
					
					 The DPRK has positively participated in activities of the UN, respecting its Charter.
					
					 The DPRK as a member state of the UN has sincerely done what it should do, steadily maintaining and expanding the contact and cooperation with the UN. By doing so, the DPRK has contributed to the activities of the UN.
					
					 The DPRK will as ever maintain close relations with the member states of the UN, guided by the idea of its foreign policy--independence, peace and friendship--and make positive efforts for building a new independent and peaceful world.

articles.title: Implementation of Oct. 4 Declaration Called for
articles.content:
Implementation of Oct. 4 Declaration Called for
Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The October 4 declaration serves as a declaration of national independence as it calls for settling the issue of national reunification independently in the spirit of "By our nation itself" while prioritizing the dignity and interests of the nation and subordinating everything to them. 
					Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes this in a signed article.
					
					It goes on:
					
					The declaration clearly indicates tasks and ways to settle all issues arising in developing the inter-Korean relations and achieving lasting peace of the country and common prosperity of the nation, guided by the idea of "By our nation itself," thus serving as a practical programme showing a shortcut to independent reunification, peace and prosperity. Herein lies the significance of the declaration. 
					
					The validity and vitality of the declaration have been fully demonstrated through the movement for national reunification over the last two years since its publication. 
					
					National reconciliation and cooperation and the development of the inter-Korean relations would be unthinkable without the historic October 4 declaration. The north and the south should uphold the declaration as a great programme for reunification common to the nation and strive to turn the inter-Korean relations into those based on the spirit of "By our nation itself", those of reconciliation and cooperation on its basis in name and reality. 
					
					The present June 15 era of reunification requires bold implementation of the October 4 declaration. All Koreans who desire independent national reunification and peace and prosperity should turn out as one in the actions to fully support the declaration and sincerely implement it regardless of their residence and occupation and ideas and social system. 
					
					All Koreans are now dynamically turning out in the struggle to implement the declaration, a patriotic programme for reunification, convinced that the cause of national reunification will make great progress and there will appear a peaceful and prosperous reunified power on this land when the declaration is successfully implemented.  
					
					No force on earth can hold in check the struggle of the Koreans to achieve independent reunification, peace and prosperity by defending and implementing the inter-Korean declarations through their concerted efforts, concludes the article.

articles.title: DPRK Film Shows Held in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK Film Shows Held in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Film shows were arranged by the African National Congress of South Africa and in Russia, Ukraine, India and Laos from Oct. 7 to 9 to mark the 64th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 83rd anniversary of the Down-with-Imperialism Union.
					 Appreciated at the shows were "Party Founding Memorial Tower", "The Arch of Triumph", "Army of Korea", "Reply of Korea" and other DPRK films.
					
					 Speeches were made at the shows.

articles.title: Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth to Be Commemorated in Arab Region
articles.content:
Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth to Be Commemorated in Arab Region
Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- An Arab regional preparatory committee was formed in Egypt on Oct. 17 to commemorate the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					Yousef Al Amiri, chairperson of the Kuwait-DPRK Friendship Association who is president of the Kuwait House of Works, was elected chairperson of the committee.
					
					The committee decided to hold colorful events for widely introducing the revolutionary exploits of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in Arab countries in the period ending April 15, 2012.

articles.title: Nombrado nuevo embajador coreano en Mongolia
articles.content:
Nombrado nuevo embajador coreano en Mongolia
Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ATCC) -- Segun el decreto correspondiente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ri Chol Gwang fue designado como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la RPDC a acreditarse en Mongolia.

articles.title: Descubiertas en Corea mas de 14 mil reliquias de la edad paleolitica
articles.content:
Descubiertas en Corea mas de 14 mil reliquias de la edad paleolitica
Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ATCC) -- En la caverna Chongphadae del distrito de Hwangju de la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte, descubierta recientemente por los cientificos de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, fueron desenterrados mas de 14 mil objetos de la edad paleolitica. 
					Esa caverna esta situada a 34 km al sudoeste de Komunmoru, famosas ruinas de la misma era situadas en el distrito de Sangwon de la ciudad de Pyongyang. 
					
					Se trata de una cueva de piedra calcarea que tiene 6 metros de ancho de entrada, 32 metros de largo desde esta hasta el otro extremo y 13.7 metros de alto.
					
					Durante el descubrimiento del estrato sedimentario de la cueva, los cientificos aclararon que alli han existido dos culturas: una de la epoca intermedia de la edad paleolitica y la otra del tiempo posterior de la misma edad. 
					
					Del estrato de la primera cultura salieron mas de 30 utensilios de piedra, entre otros, hachas de mano, lanzas y rascadores y de la capa de la segunda cultura, mas de 2 mil como arrolladores, grabadores y piedras afiladas. 
					
					Lo que atrae mas atencion es 7 fosiles del hombre correspondientes a 5 individuos que fueron hallados en el segundo estrato.
					
					Todos los fosiles como dos maxilares y tres quijadas tienen formas claras y estan bien conservados. 
					
					Se comprobo que son de los hombres de la edad Neolitica que existieron hace entre 20 mil y 60 mil anos, aproximadamente.
					
					El mas antiguo de ellos es de entre 40 mil y 60 mil anejos, aproximadamente.
					
					Es de un hombre que vivio a principios de la edad neolitica.
					
					El circulo arqueologico de Corea lo nombro como "persona de Hwangju". 
					
					Este hallazgo resulta el primero en la region de Asia del Este.
					
					Los sitios de fogata descubiertos en varios puntos bastan para imaginar que los antecesores coreanos habian usado el fuego desde la remota antiguedad.
					
					En la caverna Chongphadae fueron encontrados tambien mas de 10 mil fosiles de animales como rinoceronte de grandes cuernos, rinoceronte peludo, venado de gran cuerno, etc. 
					
					Estas especies, que habitaban en las pasadas epocas geologicas, no existen actualmente en Corea.
					
					Tambien fueron descubiertos mas de mil 570 fosiles de espora y polen.
					
					Los nuevos hallazgos arqueologicos comprueban mejor de modo cientifico y teorico que ya en los albores de la historia de la especie humana, las personas vivian en la cuenca del rio Taedong, cuyo centro es Pyongyang, creando su propia cultura.

articles.title: Periodicos denuncian maniobras belicas de EE.UU. y Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Periodicos denuncian maniobras belicas de EE.UU. y Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ATCC) -- Ahora cuando en la Peninsula Coreana se dan las senales de alivio de la situacion y el ambiente favorable a la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas, las autoridades militares del Sur de Corea y de Estados Unidos sostuvieron la "reunion consultiva anual de seguridad" con vistas a la agresion contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea abogando por el aumento de los efectivos estadounidenses y del "ofrecimiento del disuasivo ampliado".
					En sendos comentarios individuales publicados este sabado, los periodicos capitalinos lo calificaron de maniobra conflictiva con la RPDC para frenar la mejora de las relaciones Norte-Sur.
					
					El comentarista del diario Rodong Sinmun senala que la "disposicion de reaccion militar", de que hablan de manera abierta las fuerzas belicistas bajo el pretexto de la supuesta "amenaza nuclear", revelan su intencion criminal de quebrar de todos modos el ambiente de dialogo y cooperacion y resolver el problema mediante la confrontacion y la presion. 
					
					El fortalecimiento de nuestro disuasivo nuclear es el ejercicio justo de los derechos para defender la patria, el socialismo y la seguridad de toda la nacion frente a la persistente amenaza nuclear de EE.UU., afirma.
					
					Hoy dia, -prosigue- el factor amenazante en la Peninsula Coreana no es el "problema nuclear" de alguien, sino la invariable politica hostil a la RPDC de los belicistas internos y externos y sus imprudentes provocaciones militares que envenenan el ambiente de dialogo y cooperacion. 
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas deben escuchar la demanda de los nacionales y los extranjeros sobre el mejoramiento de las relaciones Norte-Sur y el cambio de la politica de confrontacion y poner de inmediato fin a la campana de provocacion militar a los connacionales, a la que recurren con las fuerzas foraneas, subraya.
					
					El rotativo Minju Joson, a su vez, apunta que traera la guerra la adhesion a EE.UU., que intenta danar con armas nucleares a los connacionales.
					
					Agrega que las autoridades surcoreanas deben tenerlo presente y actuar con prudencia sin moverse a las ordenes de EE.UU.

articles.title: ONU debe ser fiel a su mision,  demanda Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
ONU debe ser fiel a su mision,  demanda Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ATCC) -- En un articulo individual publicado este sabado, el periodico Rodong Sinmun apunto que la ONU debe cumplir satisfactoriamente con su mision y papel.
					Ante esta organizacion internacional se presenta la  importante tarea de establecer un nuevo y justo orden internacional conveniente a lo que demanda la epoca para su desarrollo en el nuevo siglo, adelanta el articulista y prosigue:
					
					La ONU debe asegurar la justicia, la imparcialidad y la igualdad en su sistema organizacional y actividades y elevar y ejercer correctamente su autoridad sin permitir las violaciones de su Carta.
					
					La realidad demanda que la ONU actue con audacia e iniciativa y cumpla el papel de vanguardia en establecer el nuevo orden internacional.
					
					La sociedad internacional desea reformar de manera mas democratica el Consejo de Seguridad.
					
					Ademas de esto, se necesita corregir los problemas tratados en contraposicion al objetivo y los principios de la Carta de la ONU.
					
					Esto resulta un asunto muy importante para incrementar la confianza de la sociedad internacional en la ONU.
					
					Cuando la ONU quede fiel a su Carta y cumpla correctamente su mision y papel conforme a la demanda de la epoca y la esperanza de la humanidad, seran resueltos muchos problemas internacionales, se lograra un gran avance en el desarrollo de la epoca y se cambiara considerablemente el perfil del mundo.
					
					Anteriormente, la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea tomo parte activa en las actividades de la ONU respetando su Carta.
					
					En calidad de miembro de la ONU, ella ha venido manteniendo y ampliando incesantemente las relaciones y la cooperacion con aquella y ha cumplido con sinceridad su deber contribuyendo a las actividades de la ONU.
					
					En el futuro tambien, la RPDC estrechara mas las relaciones con los paises miembros de la ONU segun el ideal de la politica exterior de la independencia, la paz y la amistad y se esforzara activamente por edificar un nuevo mundo independiente y pacifico.
